l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a famous person you would like to meet. You should say:
Who they are
Why they are famous
What you would talk about
And explain why you want to meet them.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'd like to describe a famous actor who is incredibly Charismatic [有魅力的]. He is known globally for his Talented [有才华的] acting in many blockbuster movies. Since he is so Influential [有影响力的], I would love to ask him about his career path. Despite his huge fame, he seems very Humble [谦逊的] and Down to earth [务实的/接地气的] in interviews. Meeting him would make me feel Relieved [如释重负的] that good people exist in Hollywood. He is truly Legendary [传奇的] in the film industry. I think his advice would be very Helpful [有帮助的] for any aspiring actor who wants to succeed.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Person: Actor / Singer
- Why: Movies / Songs
- Talk: Life / Art
- Why: Inspire / Learn

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a person who has influenced you. You should say:
Who the person is
How you know them
What they did
And explain how they influenced you.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'm going to talk about my grandmother, who is a Legendary [传奇的] figure in our family history. I have known her all my life since childhood. She was always Helpful [有帮助的] and kind to everyone she met. Although she was never In the limelight [处于聚光灯下], she was the most Influential [有影响力的] person to me. She taught me to be Humble [谦逊的] and work hard. She is my Role model [榜样] for life. I am Relieved [如释重负的] that I had her guidance growing up. She was a Talented [有才华的] cook and a Charismatic [有魅力的] storyteller who told amazing tales.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Who: Mom / Teacher
- Know: Family / School
- Did: Taught / Loved
- Influence: Values / Job

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a talented person you know. You should say:
Who they are
What their talent is
How they developed it
And explain why you admire them.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I wish to talk about my best friend who is a highly Talented [有才华的] musician. He plays the guitar beautifully and writes songs. He is very Humble [谦逊的] about his incredible skills. Because he practiced daily, he became very Charismatic [有魅力的] on stage. He is now quite Influential [有影响力的] in the local music scene. He is a Role model [榜样] for dedication and passion. Even when he is In the limelight [受人关注], he stays Down to earth [接地气的]. His music is Legendary [传奇的] among our friends. He is always Helpful [有帮助的] to beginners learning to play. I really admire his work ethic.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Friend: Musician / Artist
- Talent: Music / Paint
- How: Practice / Study
- Admire: Hard work

l2_part3_questions.question: Why are some people interested in the lives of celebrities?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] From my perspective, it is because they seek an escape from reality. [Reason] People admire the glamour and wealth of a Household name [家喻户晓的名字]. [Example] Unless they focus on their own lives, they become obsessed with the Reputation [名誉] of others. Curiosity about Scandal [丑闻] is also common in society. It is a form of easy entertainment.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Boredom. Reason: Fun to watch. Example: Reality TV shows.

l2_part3_questions.question: Do celebrities deserve privacy?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] It seems to me that everyone deserves basic Privacy [隐私]. [Reason] Just because they are famous doesn't mean they should Live in a fishbowl [毫无隐私的生活] 24/7. [Example] While the Price of fame [成名的代价] is high, aggressive Paparazzi [狗仔队] can be dangerous. They are humans too, not just products. We should respect their personal boundaries and safety.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Yes. Reason: Human rights. Example: Photos of children.

l2_part3_questions.question: How do celebrities influence young people?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I believe they have a massive impact on youth. [Reason] Young people look up to them for fashion trends and behavior Orientation [方向/定位]. [Example] Since fans develop a strong Reliance [依赖] on their idols, a celebrity's positive Contribution [贡献] can inspire good deeds. However, bad behavior can also be copied easily. It is a big responsibility for stars.

l2_part3_questions.question: What are the disadvantages of being famous?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unfortunately, the main issue is the total loss of freedom. [Reason] You cannot go anywhere without being recognized or photographed. [Example] Even though you have money, the risk of Scandal [丑闻] can ruin your Reputation [名誉] instantly. It is stressful to always be watched by the public. The Price of fame [成名的代价] is often loneliness.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Fake friends. Reason: Money. Example: People using you.

l2_part3_questions.question: Should famous people use their status to help others?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unquestionably, yes. They have the power to make a real change. [Reason] Their significant Contribution [贡献] to charity can raise millions of dollars. [Example] Provided that they are sincere, using their status as a Household name [家喻户晓的名字] helps society greatly. It sets a good example for fans. Many actors do this very well and help the world.

l2_part3_questions.question: Why do some celebrities behave badly?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I think it is because of immense pressure. [Reason] Living under constant watch can eventually break anyone's spirit. [Example] Whereas normal people have Privacy [隐私], stars Live in a fishbowl [毫无隐私的生活], often leading to public Scandal [丑闻]. They might also be immature and young. Sudden wealth can confuse people easily and lead to mistakes.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Young age. Reason: Immature. Example: Child stars going wild.
